snippet: A report says that those ages 50 to 64 watched an average of eight minutes more digital video in the second quarter of 2014, while cutting back on television viewing.
abstract: Nielsen reports that people 50 to 64 years old watched average of 19 minutes a day of digital video during second quarter of 2014, up from 11 minutes a day during same period last year; jump in online video viewing comes as adults in that age group have cut back time they spend in front of television screens by six minutes, to 6 hours and 12 minutes a day.
lead_paragraph: A report says that those ages 50 to 64 watched an average of eight minutes more digital video in the second quarter of 2014, while cutting back on television viewing.

headline.main: Nielsen Finds Older Adults Are Embracing Digital Video
headline.print_headline: Older Adults Make Move to Digital in Viewing
